TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a civil servant in ORG . At the relevant time she was on secondment to ORG for the primary education of NORP children abroad , in the city of GPE . On DATE she filed a criminal complaint for perjury and defamation against PERSON , with an application to join the proceedings as a civil party , but without claiming compensation . PERSON , a civil servant in the same Ministry , was the applicant 's immediate superior . She alleged in particular that , in connection with an administrative investigation opened against her , PERSON had stated that she did not observe TIME and did not get on well with her colleagues .

CARDINAL . On DATE , when the case was heard before ORG , the applicant reiterated her civil - party application , claiming MONEY ( MONEY ) and adduced her arguments . On DATE , ORG acquitted PERSON of the charges against him , finding that the applicant 's allegations were unsubstantiated . In particular , after examining all the evidence , the court considered that the offending remarks had been truthful and that it had not been the defendant 's intention to defame or insult the applicant ( judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE this judgment was finalised and entered in the register of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the public prosecutor at ORG to lodge an appeal on points of law against ORG judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , under LAW . She alleged , in particular , that the judgment did not contain sufficient reasoning .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG returned the applicant 's letter with the following handwritten comment on the actual request : “ There are no legal or well - founded grounds of appeal to ORG ” .
CARDINAL . The Code of Criminal Procedure contains the following relevant provisions :
“ ( CARDINAL ) The present Code specifies the instances in which a judge gives a decision or makes an order .

Orders shall also be made by the public prosecutor where he has a statutory obligation to take measures during a judicial investigation in a case or when hearings have been adjourned by the court ... ”
“ Judgments , orders of the chamber of judges , and orders of the investigating judge or of the public prosecutor shall give specific and precise reasons ...

Even where it is not required by a specific provision , all judgments and orders shall include reasoning , whether they are final or interlocutory and whether or not they depend on the discretion of the judge hearing the case . ”
“ Remedies may be used solely by persons who are expressly afforded such right by law ... ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) ... an appeal on points of law may be lodged ( a ) by the defendant ; ( b ) by a third party whose civil liability has been engaged in the conviction judgment and who has acknowledged such liability ; ( c ) by a civil party named in the conviction judgment , but only in respect of that part of the judgment in which he or she is awarded damages or is recognised as being entitled to compensation , or in which his or her claims have been dismissed as being devoid of legal basis ; ( d ) by the public prosecutor .
ORG at ORG shall be entitled to appeal on points of law against any decision within the time - limit provided for in LAW ... ”

“ The quashing of an acquittal on points of law may be sought : ( a ) by the defendant , if he or she has been acquitted for expressing remorse ; ( b ) by the principal public prosecutor ... if the acquittal has been the consequence of a misinterpretation of a substantive criminal - law provision within the meaning of LAW ; ( c ) by the person who laid the charge or the complainant , if he or she has been ordered to pay damages and costs . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) ... ORG at ORG shall summon the appellant in cassation and other parties to the proceedings , by a summons served on them in accordance with ORG to CARDINAL and within the time - limit provided for in Article CARDINAL , before ORG or its plenary assembly ...
( CARDINAL ) Where the appeal on points of law has been lodged by a public prosecutor , he shall not be summoned but shall be represented by the public prosecutor at ORG .
